reviewText:
Robbed. I actually feel like I have been mugged by the developers of this game. The HD update has rendered the game completely unplayable as the main screen turns into a bizarre white glow so that nothing is visible. Such a shame as this game is so much fun.

Seeing as this has been the case now for nearly 6 months (since the HD update) and the developers have done NOTHING to rectify the situation, I am not holding my breath for a fix anytime soon.

Stay away.

reviewText:
Agree with the guy who said he got mugged!


After a long struggle I finally managed to get this game working and I spent more time trying to fix it than playing the actual game.

I had major issues trying to run this game. First of all it would just crash on start up so run as Admin.
Then I run the game and I get a glowing white screen! So I goto graphics options to see what I can do. I decide to put graphics up to high and turn off the glowing effect. There's 2 options to switch off for glowing effect.


For some reson what I did completly messed up the game and crashed everytime on start up. So I give up. A few months lather I re-install my OS and decid to try it one more time. It worked! but I still had a glowing white screen! So I carfully changed the glow settings (dynamic lighting or somthing) and everythhing seems to run ok!

From what I gather the graphics settings are saved seperate to the actual Hotel Giant install root folder (It was for me!) meaning that even a re-install of the game would not reset the games graphics  settings to default. Leaving me with graphics settings that crashed the game and unable to change back.

Normally these settings are saved in a text file somewhere, so If anyone else is having these problems maybe your graphics settings are causing it and the only fix is to find that file to manually edit (which strangly is not in the Hotel Giant install directory nor Steam/apps/common/HotelGiant2) or re-install OS (which is a bit overkill just to get this crap game to work)

This is just terrible and to me this code is all broken. They released an update a few months back and this was not even touched upon?

reviewText:
You start the game as a small two star chain hotel manager. For you, life is cheap and your hourly rates are cheaper. Little by little you slowly devour customers and their possessions until you reach critical mass, allowing you to bribe hotel officials and pushing you up a star rating.

Upon reaching a grand total of fire stars, the hotel drops the pretence of accommodation and uproots itself from its earthly bounds and begins rampaging through a downtown of your choosing.

This is where the game really flys off the deep end interms of balance and replayability. Sure its cool watching a Novatel claw its way up the Chrysler building and swat angrily at bi-planes, but after the first time it gets fairly stale.

The controls are dodgy and sluggish (You're a fifteen story hotel, I guess it was intended) and the concept is frankly ridiculously.


I got it for a buck. Don't bother. There are better sentient building simulators out there.

reviewText: Surprisingly(I say because this is a UIG product), I've quite enjoyed this game and have been able to negate display issues. The white 'glow' was very easy to deal with by changing the settings menu 'glow' setting to 'off'(HD Update).\nAfter playing both this version(HG2) and the original(HG), I still feel as though I can put hours more into this game. The menus are very intricate and can be confusing, but as with all games, once you navigate them a few times, you learn where they are and what their hot-keys are.

reviewText:
I played the original Hotel Giant for hours on end as a child and I adored the game. This game has improved on every single feature.

Good Stuff -

1. By the looks of things the black screen and the glowing screen problems have been fixed
2. Lots of different strategies to choose from
3. Choose what sort of hotel you want to build - You can build a crappy ♥♥♥♥ hole like London or a stylish, luxurious, beautiful place like Oslo.

Bad Stuff -

1. Guests always have complaints. You can do absolutely everything they ask you to do but oh no theres always another problem. In other words they are never ♥♥♥♥ing satisfied. Ungrateful ♥♥♥♥♥
2. I hate the fact that you have to pay money to be able to add bars, games rooms, coffee shops, etc.

Overall I rate this game 7/10
